subs.text: If you’re going to quit Twitter, but still keep your account active, be sure to review your connected apps before you stop using it. If you don’t recognize the app or the app is defunct, revoke its access from your account. [link]

subs.text: @CamilleRK4 Such a bad feeling. I think of great tweets just as I’m getting off a streetcar, but that’s way too chaotic a moment to actually tweet it, and then once I come to my senses, I’m like “Well, I hope that one comes back.”
subs.rawText: @CamilleRK4 Such a bad feeling. I think of great tweets just as I’m getting off a streetcar, but that’s way too chaotic a moment to actually tweet it, and then once I come to my senses, I’m like “Well, I hope that one comes back.”

subs.text: @skinnylatte I’m kicking myself for not letting them keep believing I flew thousands of km just for a PS5. Then, in their minds, I’d be The Guy Who Flew Thousands of KM for a PS5.
subs.rawText: @skinnylatte I’m kicking myself for not letting them keep believing I flew thousands of km just for a PS5. Then, in their minds, I’d be The Guy Who Flew Thousands of KM for a PS5.

subs.text: @skinnylatte I did, somewhat hilariously, manage to pack it in my luggage and bring it home with all the rest the stuff I brought on that trip.
subs.rawText: @skinnylatte I did, somewhat hilariously, manage to pack it in my luggage and bring it home with all the rest the stuff I brought on that trip.

subs.text: @skinnylatte What worked for me: Jokingly ask the attendants at my hometown Best Buy if they have any PS5s in stock. They thought I was serious (I get that a lot), and they said they had 2. To make small talk, I told them I lived across the country, and they thought I flew in just get a PS5.
subs.rawText: @skinnylatte What worked for me: Jokingly ask the attendants at my hometown Best Buy if they have any PS5s in stock. They thought I was serious (I get that a lot), and they said they had 2. To make small talk, I told them I lived across the country, and they thought I flew in just get a PS5.

subs.text: I made Texas beef enchiladas with applewood charred corn sauce for dinner tonight. [link]
subs.rawText: I made Texas beef enchiladas with applewood charred corn sauce for dinner tonight. https://t.co/a3JHgRmNEP

subs.text: It what was possibly a first, or at least a rarity, I cooked the beef and charred the corn in the morning, so that I didn’t have to do it all at once at dinnertime. That might be a way to reduce my reluctance to cook, now that I’m busier in the evenings again.
subs.rawText: It what was possibly a first, or at least a rarity, I cooked the beef and charred the corn in the morning, so that I didn’t have to do it all at once at dinnertime. That might be a way to reduce my reluctance to cook, now that I’m busier in the evenings again.

subs.text: Axel Boman’s Family Vacation album is full of jokes, like the cowbell in one track, and the shifting time signatures in another. He wants to get your body moving, but he also wants to see if you’re paying attention. [link]

subs.text: @marksiegal I’m a creature of habit and momentum. An object at rest, etc. The last two times I moved, it was 1. for a girl and 2. for a job. The “only” things keeping me in Toronto are my board positions (I have very few friends here), plus it’s Canada’s largest, and therefore best, city.
subs.rawText: @marksiegal I’m a creature of habit and momentum. An object at rest, etc. The last two times I moved, it was 1. for a girl and 2. for a job. The “only” things keeping me in Toronto are my board positions (I have very few friends here), plus it’s Canada’s largest, and therefore best, city.

subs.text: Can somebody tell me what my interests are? A woman is asking me and I can never seem to answer that question without people’s eyes glazing over.
subs.rawText: Can somebody tell me what my interests are? A woman is asking me and I can never seem to answer that question without people’s eyes glazing over.

subs.text: I’m tempted to answer with “I own stocks through my RRSP, a little bit of cryptocurrency, and a single share of a sports club in British Columbia, and would own stock in the company I work for if it wasn’t for the mandatory options buyout,” but that’s not what she’s asking.
subs.rawText: I’m tempted to answer with “I own stocks through my RRSP, a little bit of cryptocurrency, and a single share of a sports club in British Columbia, and would own stock in the company I work for if it wasn’t for the mandatory options buyout,” but that’s not what she’s asking.

subs.text: All of my interests are consumptive in nature. I haven’t made anything, or made anything happen, in a long time. Even with the things I have made, it rarely seems like people are as eager to talk about them as I am.
subs.rawText: All of my interests are consumptive in nature. I haven’t made anything, or made anything happen, in a long time. Even with the things I have made, it rarely seems like people are as eager to talk about them as I am.

subs.text: @jeffjedras So far so good. I have a ticket to every home game in April, randomly assigned in the cheap seats. Pretty much right up my alley. I’ll try to go to each game. subs.text: If there’s any other sports club that has a 49% fan ownership model in Canada, especially if it has a youth team, and even more especially if it helps support young women and girls in athletics, please let me know. I want to be a part of that.
subs.rawText: If there’s any other sports club that has a 49% fan ownership model in Canada, especially if it has a youth team, and even more especially if it helps support young women and girls in athletics, please let me know. I want to be a part of that.

subs.text: The 6th wave of the pandemic feels like the “everybody’s going to eventually get COVID-19 and if not die from it right away, then at least slowly over time as you keep getting it year after year” phase, but it’s still not the “tell your crushes you’re in love with them” phase.
subs.rawText: The 6th wave of the pandemic feels like the “everybody’s going to eventually get COVID-19 and if not die from it right away, then at least slowly over time as you keep getting it year after year” phase, but it’s still not the “tell your crushes you’re in love with them” phase.

subs.text: What if, and hear me out on this, how about instead of demolishing the whole thing, we keep the section between Lawrence East and Scarborough Centre (or, let’s say, Midland), and the TTC just gives it to me. I’ll automate the system and maintain it. Deal? [link]
subs.rawText: What if, and hear me out on this, how about instead of demolishing the whole thing, we keep the section between Lawrence East and Scarborough Centre (or, let’s say, Midland), and the TTC just gives it to me. I’ll automate the system and maintain it. Deal? https://t.co/XD3IWUrgrG

subs.text: Uh, assuming I don’t take on any of its debt. And after I crowdfund millions of dollars for keeping that part of the system up. And set up a charitable foundation to keep it funded.

subs.text:
@hankgreen I’ll unfollow someone if their last [x] amount of tweets are about a subject that’s wearing me out. Hopefully someone will RT them into my stream.

I’ll unfollow mean people that I don’t learn anything from. That said, because you’re mean isn’t a sufficient reason to unfollow.
subs.rawText:
